snippet: German government figures show that while Germany’s trade surplus with other euro zone nations has fallen, that has been offset by a rising surplus with nations outside Europe.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off The Charts column analyzes changes in Germany's trade surplus, which has fallen to its lowest level in decades among euro nations, but is soaring with countries outside Europe; argues that phenomenon is largely explained by the financial crisis.
lead_paragraph: German government figures show that while Germany’s trade surplus with other euro zone nations has fallen, that has been offset by a rising surplus with nations outside Europe.

headline.print_headline: Outside Europe, German Trade Surplus Soars
headline.seo: Outside Europe, German Trade Surplus Soars
headline.main: Outside Europe, German Trade Surplus Soars
